title: 56 Host and Hostess Gifts to Get the Party Started
description: A guide to becoming your favorite host’s favorite guest
author: Audrey Lee
excerpt: A guide to becoming your favorite host’s favorite guest. Shop food, drink, and decor items that’ll make the perfect host and hostess gifts.
text: Picture this: You’ve received your invite, you’ve RSVP’d, and you’ve picked out the perfect outfit. All that’s left is choosing one of the best hostess gifts to bring—something we think can be a real treat. Gifts for a host are a special subsect, there’s no expectation to spend a lot of money, it’s not even assumed that guests will bring something other than a bottle of wine, meaning you can really dig into specific personality traits—and we sure did. In our search for the most thoughtful and creative gifts to buy when you’ve been invited anywhere, we found fail-safe favorites, home decor they’ll cherish, and lots of foodie options.So whether it’s a Christmas feast, an ice cream social, or just a casual aperitivo hour, stick with our list of the perfect gifts to pick up when you’re on the guest list.Our Top PicksBest overall: Aesop Resurrection Duet, $131 from AmazonBest candle: Diptyque Feu de Bois (Fire Wood) Candle, $110 from NordstromBest to pair with flowers: Fazeek Balance Vase, $125 from FazeekBest kitchen gift: Made In Red & White Wine Glassware (Set of 8), $129 from Made InBest food item: Brightland The Duo Extra Virgin Olive Oils, $74 from BrightlandBest gift under $50: Apotheke Sea Salt Grapefruit Candle, $44 from AmazonThe FoolproofsThe name says it all—showing up with one of these gifts is all but a guarantee you’ll be getting invited to every and all functions to come. Don’t think you’ll find benchwarmers anywhere on this list, every item in this category is truly an MVP. Highlights include candles that we’re positive will become staples in their scent rotation, a beautiful vase (that you should definitely pair with a bouquet of fresh flowers) and the hand-soap-moisturizer duo that’s in the bathroom of their favorite restaurant.Aesop Resurrection DuetDiptyque Feu de Bois (Fire Wood) Scented CandleMade In Red & White Wine Glassware (Set of 8)Fazeek Balance VaseBrightland The Duo Extra Virgin Olive OilsApotheke Sea Salt Grapefruit CandleGreen Thumb-ApprovedThese hostess gifts will surely thrill any friend who’s been tapping into botany or can be found at the community garden come spring and summer. In that case, it’s more than likely your host’s dinner menu is sprinkled with fresh produce and herbs they grew themselves, so they’ll really appreciate you taking the time to notice they’ve been in need of a new gardening tote bag or brought the upscale fertilizer they’ve been wanting to try.Niwaki Hori Hori and HolsterStrata Plant Vessel by Simone BrewsterWilliams Sonoma Thea Garden Tool BagBarebones Living Classic Leather Work Gloves“Sorry, We’ll Be At Our Cabin Upstate”If you secured an invite to their upstate hideaway, here’s exactly what to bring. They’ll likely have no shortage of cozy sweaters, and the maple syrup from the local farmer’s market is probably far superior to anything you’ll get from Whole Foods. But a personalized log carrier (with monogram!) or a video-enabled birdhouse? There’s your ticket to a standing invite. And if they don’t have the upstate cabin they’ve been dreaming of just yet, we also included a splurgy Postcard Cabins gift card that’ll help them live out their fantasy right now.Mark & Graham x Steele Waxed Canvas Log CarrierCozy Earth Boucle Throw BlanketTT Nature Bird Feeder with CameraPostcard Cabins Gift CardIf They Summer in the HamptonsFor every upstate cabin couple, there’s also a Hamptons-summer-house couple—it’s just the rules of nature! And while the two personalities aren’t mutually exclusive, there’s something about the salty summer air and the $100 Lobster Cobb from Duryea’s that really makes these hosts come alive. Surround them with a bit of cross-stitch and a hint of rattan to make them really swoon.Crate & Barrel Scallop Woven TraySerena & Lily Cayman Seagrass-Wrapped PitcherRecess Brooklyn Pickleball PaddleGiannini Firenze Hand-Marbled Guest BookVisiting Your Jet-Setting BestieStudying abroad in London during college was life changing for them (guilty). When visiting a friend who moved to [insert European city name here] postgrad, why not bring them a slice of home in the form of their favorite bed linens or a new backpack they can use on their impulsive weekend trips to Santorini?Buffy Breeze Sheet SetDagne Dover Nova Sling BagThe Milk Bar SamplerRuss and Daughters Caviar Lover's Black & WhiteFor The Couple Who Cosplays ParisianOui, oui! Maybe your hosts tried their hardest to find a Paris-style apartment in New York City (only to discover the truly authentic ones lacked an AC unit). And while they can’t wander around Le Marais on the daily, some high quality French butter and an upgraded knife set on their cheese board might help scratch the itch.Maison Pichon Uzès Louis XVI Ceramic Salad BowlCasafina Oak Baguette Board & Bread KnifeLaguiole Rainbow Mini Cheese Spreaders (Set of 6)Trudon Joséphine Floral Garden Candle“Have you seen this season of The Bear yet?”Did they immediately buy the NN07 jacket or the Japanese T-shirt Carmy wore in season one? Gift ideas for these world-class food lovers include something special from Noma, the actual knives and bowls featured on the show, and some best-selling salt that will make any dish—from Italian beef sandwiches to Michelin-starred meals—taste especially upscale.The Autumn Bundle by NomaMaldon Sea Salt FlakesSeisuke Sakai Kikumori Blue Steel No.1 Santoku KnifeJono Pandolfi Coupe Pasta Bowl“When is New York Getting an Erewhon?”Rare manuka honey and an elevated supermarket tote would make a thoughtful gift for the friend who has recently made sea moss a main staple in their diet. Since you know that their meal plan consists of only organic and grass-fed ingredients (and the dinner menu likely will too), we think it’s smart to bring something sweet (but still healthy) they can enjoy on their cheat day without feeling too guilty.Mount Taranaki Pure Manuka HoneyMarmalade Grove Gift BoxElia Vanilla Bean & Lemon Olive Oil Cake MixDate Better 4-Flavor Variety PackTook Bartending Course In CollegeHelp your host make ’em stronger (and more chic) with these bar upgrades. A really nice cocktail shaker, some monogrammed cocktail napkins, and a special ice tray will go a long way if your host loves concocting special drink menus for their gatherings.Alessi Cocktail ShakerCraighill Wine KeyThreads & Honey Personalized Embroidered Cocktail NapkinsFortessa Jupiter Short Tumbler (Set of 6)For The Pet ParentsWe couldn’t not show the pet parents some love. If you know you’ll be greeted not only by your host, but by their furry, four-legged friend(s) as well, consider this category your go-to! In our search for cute accessories both pets and pet lovers would love, we found some surprisingly chic clothing that’ll be nice for cooler weather and a cat scratcher they won’t be embarrassed to leave out.Little Beast x Lisa Says Gah Dog SweaterBarbour Quilted Dog CoatBeanie Bae Art Custom Pet Leather Bag TagVETRESKA Cherry Cat Scratching PostFor The ParentsAnd if Sunday through Thursday nights consist of making sure homework is done and cutting the crusts off school lunches, this group of gifts that mom and dad can enjoy will be a very thoughtful surprise. Consisting of a much-deserved spa day and sweet treats (that the kids can enjoy too), you’ll be sure to win everyone’s favor by the end of the night.Canupdog WiFi Digital Picture FrameSpafinder Gift CardBon Bon Sour & Sweet Gluten-Free MixMcConnell's Strawberries & Shortbread Cookies Ice CreamGift Baskets-GaloreGift baskets are a great way to show your host that you really know them. From spa and skin-care bundles to wine and cheese boxes, there are few hosting occasions where a gift basket—especially these very thoughtful ones we found—don’t apply.Tasty Ribbon Deluxe Breakfast In Bed Gift BoxEataly Spaghetto al Pomodoro KitBest of Porter Road BoxFolkways The Host BoxWhat’s on The Drink Menu?Maybe they don’t drink anymore…or maybe they don’t drink any less. Even if you received a last-minute invite it’s always good form to bring a bottle of wine, an aperitif, or something to the dinner party. Lucky for you, we found both alcoholic and non-alcoholic options that’ll show your hosts you were thinking of them.Orin Swift Cellars 8 Years in the Desert 2022Arlow RoséVeuve Clicquot Yellow Label Fridge Gift BoxGhia Original Non-Alcoholic Apéritif1971 Mezcal Joven, 45% ABV, MexicoJosephine No 3 Red Wine Glass (Set of 2)
html:
Picture this: You’ve received your invite, you’ve RSVP’d, and you’ve picked out the perfect outfit. All that’s left is choosing one of the best hostess gifts to bring—something we think can be a real treat. Gifts for a host are a special subsect, there’s no expectation to spend a lot of money, it’s not even assumed that guests will bring something other than a bottle of wine, meaning you can really dig into specific personality traits—and we sure did. In our search for the most thoughtful and creative gifts to buy when you’ve been invited anywhere, we found fail-safe favorites, home decor they’ll cherish, and lots of foodie options.

So whether it’s a Christmas feast, an ice cream social, or just a casual aperitivo hour, stick with our list of the perfect gifts to pick up when you’re on the guest list.

Our Top Picks

  • Best overall: Aesop Resurrection Duet, $131 from Amazon
  • Best candle: Diptyque Feu de Bois (Fire Wood) Candle, $110 from Nordstrom
  • Best to pair with flowers: Fazeek Balance Vase, $125 from Fazeek
  • Best kitchen gift: Made In Red & White Wine Glassware (Set of 8), $129 from Made In
  • Best food item: Brightland The Duo Extra Virgin Olive Oils, $74 from Brightland
  • Best gift under $50: Apotheke Sea Salt Grapefruit Candle, $44 from Amazon

The Foolproofs

The name says it all—showing up with one of these gifts is all but a guarantee you’ll be getting invited to every and all functions to come. Don’t think you’ll find benchwarmers anywhere on this list, every item in this category is truly an MVP. Highlights include candles that we’re positive will become staples in their scent rotation, a beautiful vase (that you should definitely pair with a bouquet of fresh flowers) and the hand-soap-moisturizer duo that’s in the bathroom of their favorite restaurant.

Aesop Resurrection Duet

Diptyque Feu de Bois (Fire Wood) Scented Candle

Made In Red & White Wine Glassware (Set of 8)

Fazeek Balance Vase

Brightland The Duo Extra Virgin Olive Oils

Apotheke Sea Salt Grapefruit Candle

Green Thumb-Approved

These hostess gifts will surely thrill any friend who’s been tapping into botany or can be found at the community garden come spring and summer. In that case, it’s more than likely your host’s dinner menu is sprinkled with fresh produce and herbs they grew themselves, so they’ll really appreciate you taking the time to notice they’ve been in need of a new gardening tote bag or brought the upscale fertilizer they’ve been wanting to try.

Niwaki Hori Hori and Holster

Strata Plant Vessel by Simone Brewster

Williams Sonoma Thea Garden Tool Bag

Barebones Living Classic Leather Work Gloves

“Sorry, We’ll Be At Our Cabin Upstate”

If you secured an invite to their upstate hideaway, here’s exactly what to bring. They’ll likely have no shortage of cozy sweaters, and the maple syrup from the local farmer’s market is probably far superior to anything you’ll get from Whole Foods. But a personalized log carrier (with monogram!) or a video-enabled birdhouse? There’s your ticket to a standing invite. And if they don’t have the upstate cabin they’ve been dreaming of just yet, we also included a splurgy Postcard Cabins gift card that’ll help them live out their fantasy right now.

Mark & Graham x Steele Waxed Canvas Log Carrier

Cozy Earth Boucle Throw Blanket

TT Nature Bird Feeder with Camera

Postcard Cabins Gift Card

If They Summer in the Hamptons

For every upstate cabin couple, there’s also a Hamptons-summer-house couple—it’s just the rules of nature! And while the two personalities aren’t mutually exclusive, there’s something about the salty summer air and the $100 Lobster Cobb from Duryea’s that really makes these hosts come alive. Surround them with a bit of cross-stitch and a hint of rattan to make them really swoon.

Crate & Barrel Scallop Woven Tray

Serena & Lily Cayman Seagrass-Wrapped Pitcher

Recess Brooklyn Pickleball Paddle

Giannini Firenze Hand-Marbled Guest Book

Visiting Your Jet-Setting Bestie

Studying abroad in London during college was life changing for them (guilty). When visiting a friend who moved to [insert European city name here] postgrad, why not bring them a slice of home in the form of their favorite bed linens or a new backpack they can use on their impulsive weekend trips to Santorini?

Buffy Breeze Sheet Set

Dagne Dover Nova Sling Bag

The Milk Bar Sampler

Russ and Daughters Caviar Lover's Black & White

For The Couple Who Cosplays Parisian

Oui, oui! Maybe your hosts tried their hardest to find a Paris-style apartment in New York City (only to discover the truly authentic ones lacked an AC unit). And while they can’t wander around Le Marais on the daily, some high quality French butter and an upgraded knife set on their cheese board might help scratch the itch.

Maison Pichon Uzès Louis XVI Ceramic Salad Bowl

Casafina Oak Baguette Board & Bread Knife

Laguiole Rainbow Mini Cheese Spreaders (Set of 6)

Trudon Joséphine Floral Garden Candle

“Have you seen this season of The Bear yet?”

Did they immediately buy the NN07 jacket or the Japanese T-shirt Carmy wore in season one? Gift ideas for these world-class food lovers include something special from Noma, the actual knives and bowls featured on the show, and some best-selling salt that will make any dish—from Italian beef sandwiches to Michelin-starred meals—taste especially upscale.

The Autumn Bundle by Noma

Maldon Sea Salt Flakes

Seisuke Sakai Kikumori Blue Steel No.1 Santoku Knife

Jono Pandolfi Coupe Pasta Bowl

“When is New York Getting an Erewhon?”

Rare manuka honey and an elevated supermarket tote would make a thoughtful gift for the friend who has recently made sea moss a main staple in their diet. Since you know that their meal plan consists of only organic and grass-fed ingredients (and the dinner menu likely will too), we think it’s smart to bring something sweet (but still healthy) they can enjoy on their cheat day without feeling too guilty.

Mount Taranaki Pure Manuka Honey

Marmalade Grove Gift Box

Elia Vanilla Bean & Lemon Olive Oil Cake Mix

Date Better 4-Flavor Variety Pack

Took Bartending Course In College

Help your host make ’em stronger (and more chic) with these bar upgrades. A really nice cocktail shaker, some monogrammed cocktail napkins, and a special ice tray will go a long way if your host loves concocting special drink menus for their gatherings.

Alessi Cocktail Shaker

Craighill Wine Key

Threads & Honey Personalized Embroidered Cocktail Napkins

Fortessa Jupiter Short Tumbler (Set of 6)

For The Pet Parents

We couldn’t not show the pet parents some love. If you know you’ll be greeted not only by your host, but by their furry, four-legged friend(s) as well, consider this category your go-to! In our search for cute accessories both pets and pet lovers would love, we found some surprisingly chic clothing that’ll be nice for cooler weather and a cat scratcher they won’t be embarrassed to leave out.

Little Beast x Lisa Says Gah Dog Sweater

Barbour Quilted Dog Coat

Beanie Bae Art Custom Pet Leather Bag Tag

VETRESKA Cherry Cat Scratching Post

For The Parents

And if Sunday through Thursday nights consist of making sure homework is done and cutting the crusts off school lunches, this group of gifts that mom and dad can enjoy will be a very thoughtful surprise. Consisting of a much-deserved spa day and sweet treats (that the kids can enjoy too), you’ll be sure to win everyone’s favor by the end of the night.

Canupdog WiFi Digital Picture Frame

Spafinder Gift Card

Bon Bon Sour & Sweet Gluten-Free Mix

McConnell's Strawberries & Shortbread Cookies Ice Cream

Gift Baskets-Galore

Gift baskets are a great way to show your host that you really know them. From spa and skin-care bundles to wine and cheese boxes, there are few hosting occasions where a gift basket—especially these very thoughtful ones we found—don’t apply.

Tasty Ribbon Deluxe Breakfast In Bed Gift Box

Eataly Spaghetto al Pomodoro Kit

Best of Porter Road Box

Folkways The Host Box

What’s on The Drink Menu?

Maybe they don’t drink anymore…or maybe they don’t drink any less. Even if you received a last-minute invite it’s always good form to bring a bottle of wine, an aperitif, or something to the dinner party. Lucky for you, we found both alcoholic and non-alcoholic options that’ll show your hosts you were thinking of them.

Orin Swift Cellars 8 Years in the Desert 2022

Arlow Rosé

Veuve Clicquot Yellow Label Fridge Gift Box

Ghia Original Non-Alcoholic Apéritif

1971 Mezcal Joven, 45% ABV, Mexico

Josephine No 3 Red Wine Glass (Set of 2)
